trans-unit.source: ACS Management Service API Reference
trans-unit.target: ACS Management Service API Reference

trans-unit.source: ACS Management Service API Reference
trans-unit.target: ACS Management Service API Reference

trans-unit.source: An entity data model organizes the <token>firstref_acs</token> configuration data into records of <newTerm>entity types</newTerm> (or <newTerm>entities</newTerm>) and the associations between them.
trans-unit.target: An entity data model organizes the <token>firstref_acs</token> configuration data into records of <newTerm>entity types</newTerm> (or <newTerm>entities</newTerm>) and the associations between them.

trans-unit.source: The data model is described in the OData Service Metadata Document for each namespace is at: <ui>https://<namespace>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service/$metadata</ui>, where <placeholder><namespace></placeholder> is the name of the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: The data model is described in the OData Service Metadata Document for each namespace is at: <ui>https://<namespace>.accesscontrol.windows.net/v2/mgmt/service/$metadata</ui>, where <placeholder><namespace></placeholder> is the name of the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: This XML-based OData document uses a conceptual schema definition language (CDSL) to describe the available data.
trans-unit.target: This XML-based OData document uses a conceptual schema definition language (CDSL) to describe the available data.

trans-unit.source: You can download this document and use it to generate typed classes in your code.
trans-unit.target: You can download this document and use it to generate typed classes in your code.

trans-unit.source: The following table describes the <token>secondref_acs</token> entity types.
trans-unit.target: The following table describes the <token>secondref_acs</token> entity types.

trans-unit.source: The following applies to ID properties of all of the entities in the table: <token>secondref_acs</token> IDs are not permanent; they can change as a result of upgrades to the <token>secondref_acs</token> service.
trans-unit.target: The following applies to ID properties of all of the entities in the table: <token>secondref_acs</token> IDs are not permanent; they can change as a result of upgrades to the <token>secondref_acs</token> service.

trans-unit.source: Your applications should not cache or rely on the value of <token>secondref_acs</token> IDs.
trans-unit.target: Your applications should not cache or rely on the value of <token>secondref_acs</token> IDs.

trans-unit.source: Entity
trans-unit.target: Entity

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Represents claim types imported from the WS-Federation metadata of WS-Federation identity providers.
trans-unit.target: Represents claim types imported from the WS-Federation metadata of WS-Federation identity providers.

trans-unit.source: This is used primarily to populate the list of supported claim types for each identity provider in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.
trans-unit.target: This is used primarily to populate the list of supported claim types for each identity provider in the <token>secondref_acs</token> Management Portal.

trans-unit.source: Represents a rule with two input claims.
trans-unit.target: Represents a rule with two input claims.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.

trans-unit.source: Represents a list of clients that have been granted delegated access in OAuth 2.0 delegation scenarios.
trans-unit.target: Represents a list of clients that have been granted delegated access in OAuth 2.0 delegation scenarios.

trans-unit.source: Represents an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Represents an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: For more information about identity providers, see <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Identity Providers</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about identity providers, see <link xlink:href="f57b2985-872b-419a-97b1-4758e6908dc7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Identity Providers</link>.

trans-unit.source: Represents a URI that is associated with an identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Represents a URI that is associated with an identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Supported URI types include SignIn, SignOut, EmailDomain, ImageURL, and FedMetadataURL.
trans-unit.target: Supported URI types include SignIn, SignOut, EmailDomain, ImageURL, and FedMetadataURL.

trans-unit.source: Represents the list of ClaimType entities that are supported by the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Represents the list of ClaimType entities that are supported by the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Represents certificates and keys associated with the identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Represents certificates and keys associated with the identity provider.

trans-unit.source: This typically includes token validation certificates imported from the identity provider’s WS-Federation metadata or keys input directly into the <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration (such as Facebook application keys).
trans-unit.target: This typically includes token validation certificates imported from the identity provider’s WS-Federation metadata or keys input directly into the <token>secondref_acs</token> configuration (such as Facebook application keys).

trans-unit.source: Represents a claims issuer that is another representation of an identity provider that is used specifically by the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine.
trans-unit.target: Represents a claims issuer that is another representation of an identity provider that is used specifically by the <token>secondref_acs</token> rules engine.

trans-unit.source: <token>secondref_acs</token> also has its own built-in issuer, named LOCAL_AUTHORITY, which is the issuer for claims output by <token>secondref_acs</token>.
trans-unit.target: <token>secondref_acs</token> also has its own built-in issuer, named LOCAL_AUTHORITY, which is the issuer for claims output by <token>secondref_acs</token>.

trans-unit.source: Every identity provider has an associated issuer and every issuer that’s not LOCAL_AUTHORITY has an associated identity provider.
trans-unit.target: Every identity provider has an associated issuer and every issuer that’s not LOCAL_AUTHORITY has an associated identity provider.

trans-unit.source: If you delete the issuer, it automatically deletes the associated identity provider.
trans-unit.target: If you delete the issuer, it automatically deletes the associated identity provider.

trans-unit.source: Represents a relying party application.
trans-unit.target: Represents a relying party application.

trans-unit.source: For more information about relying party applications, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about relying party applications, see <link xlink:href="16708a9e-e1f1-4ad5-bed2-a49ccabc42b9" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Relying Party Applications</link>.

trans-unit.source: Represents a URI that is associated with a relying party application.
trans-unit.target: Represents a URI that is associated with a relying party application.

trans-unit.source: Supported URI types include Realm, Reply (Return URL), and Error (Error URL).
trans-unit.target: Supported URI types include Realm, Reply (Return URL), and Error (Error URL).

trans-unit.source: Represents which identity providers are associated with which relying party applications in a given <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: Represents which identity providers are associated with which relying party applications in a given <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: Represents certificates and keys associated with a relying party application.
trans-unit.target: Represents certificates and keys associated with a relying party application.

trans-unit.source: This includes token signing certificates and symmetric keys associated directly with the application, in addition to encryption certificates.
trans-unit.target: This includes token signing certificates and symmetric keys associated directly with the application, in addition to encryption certificates.

trans-unit.source: Represents the list of RuleGroup entities that are associated with the relying party application.
trans-unit.target: Represents the list of RuleGroup entities that are associated with the relying party application.

trans-unit.source: Represents a rule.
trans-unit.target: Represents a rule.

trans-unit.source: For more information about rules, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about rules, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.

trans-unit.source: Represents a rule group.
trans-unit.target: Represents a rule group.

trans-unit.source: For more information about rule groups, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about rule groups, see <link xlink:href="7ef0ec98-9fa8-4671-bcf7-630ebb06ec7e" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Rule Groups and Rules</link>.

trans-unit.source: Represents a service identity.
trans-unit.target: Represents a service identity.

trans-unit.source: For more information about service identities, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about service identities, see <link xlink:href="52225343-ab35-4455-b3f9-e014d7ac6b78" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Identities</link>.

trans-unit.source: Represents credentials associated with service identities.
trans-unit.target: Represents credentials associated with service identities.

trans-unit.source: This includes X.509 certificates, symmetric keys, and passwords.
trans-unit.target: This includes X.509 certificates, symmetric keys, and passwords.

trans-unit.source: Represents certificates and keys assigned to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.
trans-unit.target: Represents certificates and keys assigned to the <token>ad_acs_namespace</token>.

trans-unit.source: This includes token signing certificates and symmetric keys, token decryption certificates, and Management Service credentials for the default ManagementClient account.
trans-unit.target: This includes token signing certificates and symmetric keys, token decryption certificates, and Management Service credentials for the default ManagementClient account.

trans-unit.source: This does not include certificates and keys explicitly assigned to a relying party application, identity provider, or service identity.
trans-unit.target: This does not include certificates and keys explicitly assigned to a relying party application, identity provider, or service identity.
